body: Hmm, that would be a bug, but I am not seeing this in master. Can you update to the latest master, clear your browser cache and retry? Also, if you still see the problem, can you give us information about your setup (OS, IPython version, config files, command line args)? Thanks.

i just pulled master, and the behavior is the same.  i am using chrome  and cleared cache using `preferences->tools->clear browsing cache`
browser : chrome 
OS : linux (mint)
IPython: master (do you want git hash?)

starting with 

> ipython notebook
> 2014-03-21 12:38:12.596 [NotebookApp] Using existing profile dir: u'/home/alex/.ipython/profile_default'
> 2014-03-21 12:38:12.619 [NotebookApp] Serving local MathJax from /home/alex/.ipython/profile_default/static/mathjax/MathJax.js at /static/mathjax/MathJax.js

> 2014-03-21 12:38:12.632 [NotebookApp] Use Control-C to stop this server and shut down all kernels (twice to skip confirmation).

do you want my profile as well ?
Sharing your profile might help as well (excluding any potentially sensitive information).


Change your

```
c.NotebookManager.notebook_dir = '~/notebooks'
```

config to

```
c.NotebookApp.notebook_dir = '~/notebooks'
```

in order to set both the notebook root and the kernel starting directory

works thanks!
perhaps a suggestion to create a new profile for people upgrading to 2.0 would prevent others from this mishap.
Yes, that took me 1 day to find out, maybe it should be added to the release-notes.
